verses.text: Come \w down|strong="H3381"\w*, and \w sit|strong="H3427"\w* in the \w dust|strong="H6083"\w*, O \w virgin|strong="H1330"\w* \w daughter|strong="H1323"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w*, \w sit|strong="H3427"\w* on the \w ground|strong="H0776"\w*: \add there is\add* no \w throne|strong="H3678"\w*, O \w daughter|strong="H1323"\w* of the \w Chaldeans|strong="H3778"\w*: for thou shalt no \w more|strong="H3254"\w* be \w called|strong="H7121"\w* \w tender|strong="H7390"\w* and \w delicate|strong="H6028"\w*.

\w Take|strong="H3947"\w* the \w millstones|strong="H7347"\w*, and \w grind|strong="H2912"\w* \w meal|strong="H7058"\w*: \w uncover|strong="H1540"\w* thy \w locks|strong="H6777"\w*, make \w bare|strong="H2834"\w* the \w leg|strong="H7640"\w*, \w uncover|strong="H1540"\w* the \w thigh|strong="H7785"\w*, pass \w over|strong="H5674"\w* the \w rivers|strong="H5104"\w*.

Thy \w nakedness|strong="H6172"\w* shall be \w uncovered|strong="H1540"\w*, yea, thy \w shame|strong="H2781"\w* shall be \w seen|strong="H7200"\w*: I will \w take|strong="H3947"\w* \w vengeance|strong="H5359"\w*, and I will not \w meet|strong="H6293"\w* \add thee as\add* a \w man|strong="H0120"\w*.

\add As for\add* our \w redeemer|strong="H1350"\w*, the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of \w hosts|strong="H6635"\w* \add is\add* his \w name|strong="H8034"\w*, the Holy \w One|strong="H6918"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*.

\w Sit|strong="H3427"\w* thou \w silent|strong="H1748"\w*, and \w get|strong="H0935"\w* thee into \w darkness|strong="H2822"\w*, O \w daughter|strong="H1323"\w* of the \w Chaldeans|strong="H3778"\w*: for thou shalt no \w more|strong="H3254"\w* be \w called|strong="H7121"\w*, The \w lady|strong="H1404"\w* of \w kingdoms|strong="H4467"\w*.

¶ I was \w wroth|strong="H7107"\w* with my \w people|strong="H5971"\w*, I have \w polluted|strong="H2490"\w* mine \w inheritance|strong="H5159"\w*, and \w given|strong="H5414"\w* them into thine \w hand|strong="H3027"\w*: thou didst \w shew|strong="H7760"\w* them no \w mercy|strong="H7356"\w*; upon the \w ancient|strong="H2205"\w* hast thou \w very|strong="H3966"\w* \w heavily|strong="H3513"\w* laid thy \w yoke|strong="H5923"\w*.

¶ And thou \w saidst|strong="H0559"\w*, I shall be a \w lady|strong="H1404"\w* for \w ever|strong="H5769"\w*: \add so\add* that thou didst not \w lay|strong="H7760"\w* these \add things\add* to thy \w heart|strong="H3820"\w*, neither didst \w remember|strong="H2142"\w* the latter \w end|strong="H0319"\w* of it.

Therefore \w hear|strong="H8085"\w* now this, \add thou that art\add* given to \w pleasures|strong="H5719"\w*, that \w dwellest|strong="H3427"\w* \w carelessly|strong="H0983"\w*, that \w sayest|strong="H0559"\w* in thine \w heart|strong="H3824"\w*, I \add am\add*, and none \w else|strong="H0657"\w* beside me; I shall not \w sit|strong="H3427"\w* \add as\add* a \w widow|strong="H0490"\w*, neither shall I \w know|strong="H3045"\w* the loss of \w children|strong="H7908"\w*:

But these \w two|strong="H8147"\w* \add things\add* shall \w come|strong="H0935"\w* to thee in a \w moment|strong="H7281"\w* in \w one|strong="H0259"\w* \w day|strong="H3117"\w*, the loss of \w children|strong="H7908"\w*, and \w widowhood|strong="H0489"\w*: they shall \w come|strong="H0935"\w* upon thee in their \w perfection|strong="H8537"\w* for the \w multitude|strong="H7230"\w* of thy \w sorceries|strong="H3785"\w*, \add and\add* for the \w great|strong="H3966"\w* \w abundance|strong="H6109"\w* of thine \w enchantments|strong="H2267"\w*.

¶ For thou hast \w trusted|strong="H0982"\w* in thy \w wickedness|strong="H7451"\w*: thou hast \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, None \w seeth|strong="H7200"\w* me. Thy \w wisdom|strong="H2451"\w* and thy \w knowledge|strong="H1847"\w*, it hath \w perverted|strong="H7725"\w* thee; and thou hast \w said|strong="H0559"\w* in thine \w heart|strong="H3820"\w*, I \add am\add*, and none \w else|strong="H0657"\w* beside me.\f + \fr 47.10 \ft perverted…: or, caused thee to turn away\f*

¶ Therefore shall \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* \w come|strong="H0935"\w* upon thee; thou shalt not \w know|strong="H3045"\w* from whence it \w riseth|strong="H7837"\w*: and \w mischief|strong="H1943"\w* shall \w fall|strong="H5307"\w* upon thee; thou shalt not be \w able|strong="H3201"\w* to put it \w off|strong="H3722"\w*: and \w desolation|strong="H7722"\w* shall \w come|strong="H0935"\w* upon thee \w suddenly|strong="H6597"\w*, \add which\add* thou shalt not \w know|strong="H3045"\w*.\f + \fr 47.11 \ft from…: Heb. the morning thereof\f*\f + \fr 47.11 \ft put: Heb. expiate\f*

\w Stand|strong="H5975"\w* now with thine \w enchantments|strong="H2267"\w*, and with the \w multitude|strong="H7230"\w* of thy \w sorceries|strong="H3785"\w*, \w wherein|strong="H0834"\w* thou hast \w laboured|strong="H3021"\w* from thy \w youth|strong="H5271"\w*; if so be thou shalt be \w able|strong="H3201"\w* to \w profit|strong="H3276"\w*, if so be thou mayest \w prevail|strong="H6206"\w*.

Thou art \w wearied|strong="H3811"\w* in the \w multitude|strong="H7230"\w* of thy \w counsels|strong="H6098"\w*. Let now the \w astrologers|strong="H1895"\w*, the \w stargazers|strong="H2374"\w*, the \w monthly|strong="H2320"\w* \w prognosticators|strong="H3045"\w*, stand \w up|strong="H5975"\w*, and \w save|strong="H3467"\w* thee from \add these things\add* that shall \w come|strong="H0935"\w* upon thee.\f + \fr 47.13 \ft astrologers: Heb. viewers of the heavens\f*\f + \fr 47.13 \ft the monthly…: Heb. that give knowledge concerning the months\f*

Behold, they shall be as \w stubble|strong="H7179"\w*; the \w fire|strong="H0784"\w* shall \w burn|strong="H8313"\w* them; they shall not \w deliver|strong="H5337"\w* \w themselves|strong="H5315"\w* from the \w power|strong="H3027"\w* of the \w flame|strong="H3852"\w*: \add there shall\add* not \add be\add* a \w coal|strong="H1513"\w* to \w warm|strong="H2552"\w* at, \add nor\add* \w fire|strong="H0217"\w* to \w sit|strong="H3427"\w* before it.\f + \fr 47.14 \ft themselves: Heb. their souls\f*

Thus shall they be unto thee with whom thou hast \w laboured|strong="H3021"\w*, \add even\add* thy \w merchants|strong="H5503"\w*, from thy \w youth|strong="H5271"\w*: they shall \w wander|strong="H8582"\w* every \w one|strong="H0376"\w* to his \w quarter|strong="H5676"\w*; none shall \w save|strong="H3467"\w* thee.
